name: NPR
text:
The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences says 45% of those invited to join its membership this year are women and 36% are from underrepresented ethnic and racial communities.

However, the Academy remains largely white and male overall.
https://t.co/xsFZixL7QM

name: NPR
text: President Trump says painting "Black Lives Matter" on the street that runs in front of Trump Tower would amount to "denigrating this luxury Avenue," and hopes New York City police "won’t let this symbol of hate be affixed to New York’s greatest street." https://t.co/iORHpxr6eZ

name: NPR
text:
Feras Fayyad was the first witness to testify in a trial examining state-sponsored torture in President Bashar Assad’s Syria. His case involves an alleged rape.

“We need to know who is committing these crimes,” he says. “There is no way to stay silent.” https://t.co/aPjL0iiJbg
